review: Off the charts with flavour. Blackberry is the dominant note. Expectional coffee.
Lacking personality. Inoffensive but nothing to it.

tastingNotes: Pinot Gris, Fermented Pineapple, Orange Citrus, White Sugar
review: Very interesting coffee. Geniunely has a pinot gris flavour. Closer to a wine than a coffee.

tastingNotes: Raspberries, Stone fruit, Maple Syrup, and Orange
review: Delicate and stone fruit on the palate. Not the most interesting Kenyan coffee, but good variety from yesterday.

tastingNotes: Cooked Plum, Blackcurrant, Red Berries, with a Cola Finish
review: Clean and very juicy. Blackcurrant is distiguishable.
Not very interesting. Light and lacking depth.

processorType: Co-Operative Pour La Promotion Des Activites Cafe
review: Typical east African coffee. When tasting back to back with so many others, it's perhaps suffering from comparison. There's not as much flair as some of the others.

tastingNotes: Strawberry Wine, White Grape, Forest Fruit
review: Amazingly tastes like starwberry. Incredible coffee. So different to the idea of coffee.

tastingNotes: Vanilla Bean, Nectarine, Bergamot, and Rhubarb
review: Absolute flavour bomb. Rhubarb and nectarine are the closest way to describe it but there's a sympthony of flavours and mouth feel.

Tasting notes are maybe a bit generous. There's a sweetness to it and it'd probably be easy enough to get through a bag of it but it's plain compared to the others. Sprinkling these coffee's in though is a good way to reset the palate.
